pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:0.5: 25. The training rule on giving robe-cloth
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.1: On one occasion when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.2: a certain monk was walking for almsfood along a street in Sāvatthī, as was a certain nun.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.3: And that monk said to that nun, “Go to such-and-such a place, Sister, and you’ll get alms,”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.4: and she said the same to him.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.5: And because they met frequently, they became friends.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.6: Just then robe-cloth belonging to the Sangha was being distributed.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.7: Then, after going to the instruction, that nun approached that monk, and bowed.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.8: He then said to her, “Sister, will you accept my share of the robe-cloth?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.10: And he gave his robe-cloth to that nun.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.11: As a consequence his robes, too, became worn.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.12: Other monks said to him, “Why don’t you make a robe for yourself?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.13: And he told them what had happened.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.14: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.15: “How can a monk give robe-cloth to a nun?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.16: “Is it true, monk, that you did this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.20: “Foolish man, a man and a woman who are not related don’t know what’s appropriate and what’s inappropriate in dealing with each other, what’s right and what’s wrong.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.21: And still you gave robe-cloth to an unrelated nun.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.22: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.23: And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.24.1: ‘If a monk gives robe-cloth to an unrelated nun, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.25: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:2.1: Once this had happened, monks did not even give robe-cloth to nuns in exchange, being afraid of wrongdoing.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:2.2: The nuns complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:2.3: “How can they not give us robe-cloth in exchange?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:2.4: The monks heard the complaints of those nuns
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:2.6: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:2.7: “Monks, if it is part of an exchange, I allow you to give things to five kinds of people:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:2.8: monks, nuns, trainee nuns, novice monks, and novice nuns.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:2.10: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:2.11.1: ‘If a monk gives robe-cloth to an unrelated nun, except if it is an exchange, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.1.4: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.1.6: anyone who is not a descendant of one’s male ancestors going back seven generations, either on the mother’s side or on the father’s side.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.1.8: she has been given the full ordination by both Sanghas.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.1.10: one of the six kinds of robe-cloth, but not smaller than what can be transferred to another.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.1.11: Except if it is an exchange:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.2.1: If she is unrelated and he perceives her as such, and he gives her robe-cloth, except if it is an exchange, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.2.2: If she is unrelated, but he is unsure of it, and he gives her robe-cloth, except if it is an exchange, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.2.3: If she is unrelated, but he perceives her as related, and he gives her robe-cloth, except if it is an exchange, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.2.4: If he gives robe-cloth to a nun who is fully ordained only on one side, except if it is an exchange, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.2.5: If she is related, but he perceives her as unrelated, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.2.6: If she is related, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.2.7: If she is related and he perceives her as such, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.3.3: if much is exchanged with little or little is exchanged with much;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.3.4: if the nun takes it on trust;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.3.6: if he gives any requisite apart from robe-cloth;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.3.7: if it is a trainee nun;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.3.8: if it is a novice nun;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.3.10: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.3.11: The fifth rule, the training rule on giving robe-cloth, is finished.
